definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: It was the first gold won by a swimmer in a Speedo suit in Rome.
sentences.chinese: 这是身着Speedo泳衣的运动员首次在罗马夺金。

sentences.english: Well heeled: The stars were back in their stilettos and glamorous frocks .
sentences.chinese: 女星们个个身着漂亮的连衣裙和高跟鞋。

sentences.english: They wear white robes as well, and wear cone-shaped hats decorated with stars.
sentences.chinese: 他们也身着白袍，头戴装饰有星星的尖顶帽。

sentences.english: Some photos were of beauty queens in evening gowns or other high-status clothing.
sentences.chinese: 有些照片是身着晚礼服或者其他显贵衣服的选美皇后。

sentences.english: France said that the batterer is dressed in plain clothes security personnel in Iran.
sentences.chinese: 法国方面称，打人者是身着便衣的伊朗安全人员。

sentences.english: Nor is he seen wearing something new every time he is in public.
sentences.chinese: 他也并非每次现身公众场合时都身着新衣。

sentences.english: The groom wore the white dress uniform of Monaco's Carabinieri royal guard.
sentences.chinese: 新郎身着摩纳哥皇家卫队宪兵白色制服。

sentences.english: The five agents are encased in body armor and are toting semiautomatic weapons.
sentences.chinese: 五个身着防弹衣的特工手持半自动武器。

sentences.english: He wears traditional salwar kameez and a Rolex watch.
sentences.chinese: 他身着传统的印度长袍，手上戴一块劳力士表。

sentences.english: Mary was diked out in her Sunday best.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽身着盛装，打扮得漂漂亮亮。

sentences.english: On the book's dust jacket, Bush is shown in a ranching outfit.
sentences.chinese: 在这本书不满灰尘的封面上，布什身着一套农场制服。

sentences.english: You can come in costume, or dress casually, according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 你可以身着戏服，或者休闲装，随天气制宜。

sentences.english: Borowski wears corduroy suits and plays the accordion.
sentences.chinese: 博罗夫斯基身着一套灯芯绒西装，会拉手风琴。

sentences.english: Dressed in black for the trial, eyes hidden behind sunglasses, Linor had to be strong.
sentences.chinese: 庭审时林诺身着黑衣头戴墨镜，表现得很坚强。

sentences.english: The hall was crowed with government officials in full dress.
sentences.chinese: 大厅中满是身着大礼服的政府官员。

sentences.english: Sometimes later, I found a photo of a rock star dressed in a Kimono.
sentences.chinese: 后来，我看到一张摇滚明星身着和服的照片。

definition: whole body/from head to toe/single person/a suit of clothes
ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
woman's suit/dress worn over a petticoat
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
